humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report indicates that the size of the largest invasive carcinoma is 9.0 cm, which is greater than 5 cm. Following the rules provided, this corresponds to a T3 tumor.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The T stage of a cancer is determined by the size of the primary tumor. In this report, the size of the largest focus of invasion is given as 9.0 cm. According to the TNM staging system, a T3 stage is given to tumors that are larger than 50 mm in greatest dimension. Therefore, the predicted T stage for this patient is T3.
